Description: Sherd from shoulder of black-figured pottery oinochoe; band of plain tongues at top of shoulder; below, head of a man and head of a woman (added white paint), both to right; row of dots in field; rough style; inside reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 61-2, no. 19)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GS.335)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: VII.19 (cat. no. in Prins de Jong 1925)
